description:
first time boot nova or clean the pci devices from nova database then reboot n-cpu, will leading to scheduling the VM with pci devices fail.   if then reboot the n-cpu, everything is ok.

this bug now block the third-party pci-test.
title: boot n-cpu from a clean database lead to pci passthrough stop work

comments.content:
first time boot nova or clean the pci devices from nova database will leading to scheduling the VM with pci devices fail.   then reboot the n-cpu, everything is ok. 

i suspect this related to recently pci stats changes, but not confirm yet.  this bug now block the third-party pci-test.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yongli-he

comments.content:
the reason of this problem because reported pci devices's "status" is "none"  when saved to pci_devices

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
root cause:
 when pci_devices table is empty, the pci devices will detached from DB because it's _context is None. this will leading to allocation pci devices fail, refer to:   pci/stats.py

 _handle_device_dependents
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yongli-he

comments.content:
This bug should be critical. It block PCI and SRIOV CI.
Also block nova users with pci device pass through.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~shaohef

comments.content: this been fixed by another patch, so no block bug now. PCI CI is back on line.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yongli-he
